intro: Salpiglossis linifolia, commonly known as the lipped pink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period and ability to attract pollinators.
